item.title: Learning Styles
item.description: Print as Superior Medium for Information Transmission Almost all people read faster than they can comfortably listen to someone speak. (Ever try reading the transcript of a podcast and then listening to it at 2.5x speed? It should make what I'm talking about obvious). Reading is also much faster than taking in most types of complex/overly difficult information in some sort of visual form (e.g., a table). It's also worth pointing out that nothing stops writers from including charts, graphs, pictures, etc.
